intro: Cladochaeta, commonly known as the "bushy cress," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are characterized by their compact, often hairy foliage and small, cruciform flowers. They typically grow in moist, temperate environments, such as meadows and streambanks. Cladochaeta species are herbaceous and may have a creeping or upright growth habit. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
